text.0: be like thyself o indra strong for our delight here lauded aid us maghavan drinker of the juice.
text.1: savitar with the gods protect us hear ye twain we ask for freedom and complete felicity.
text.2: bring swift for offering the snare that suits the time to the puredrinker vāyu roaring as he goes.
text.3: to him who hath approached the draught of shining milk we ask for freedom and complete felicity.
text.4: may savitar the god send us full life to each who sacrifices lives aright and pours the juice.
text.5: that we with simple hearts may wait upon the gods we ask for freedom and complete felicity.
text.6: may indra evermore be gracious unto us and may king soma meditate our happiness.
text.7: even as men secure the comfort of a friend we ask for freedom and complete felicity.
text.8: indra hath given the body with its song and strength bṛhaspati thou art the lengthener of life.
text.9: the sacrifice is manu providence our sire we ask for freedom and complete felicity.
text.10: indra possesseth might celestial nobly formed the singer in the house is agni prudent sage.
text.11: he is the sacrifice in synod fair most near we ask for freedom and complete felicity.
text.12: not often have we sinned against you secretly nor vasus have we openly provoked the gods.
text.13: not one of its ye gods hath worn an alien shape we ask for freedom and complete felicity.
text.14: may savitar remove from us our malady and may the mountains keep it far away from where.
text.15: the pressstone as it sheds the meath rings loudly forth we ask for freedom and complete felicity.
text.16: ye vasus let the stone the presser stand erect avert all enmities and keep them far remote.
text.17: our guard to be adored is savitar this god we ask for freedom and complete felicity.
text.18: eat strength and fatness in the pasture kine who are balmed at the reservoir and at the seat of law.
text.19: so let your body be our bodys medicine we ask for freedom and complete felicity.
text.20: the singer fills the spirit all mens love hath he indra takes kindly care of those who pour the juice.
text.21: for his libation is the heavenly udder full we ask for freedom and complete felicity.
text.22: wondrous thy spiritfilling light triumpliant thy hosts save from decay and are resistless.
text.23: the pious votary by straightest pathway speeds to possess the best of all the cattle.
